intro: Asplenium persicifolium var. atrovirens, commonly known as the dark green maidenhair fern, is a variant of the Persian spleenwort. It is a member of the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds. The leaves are typically dark green and have a glossy appearance, with a finely divided structure. This fern thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and conservation efforts.
